question:
If \(|\frac{a}{b}|\) and \(|\frac{x}{y}|\) are reciprocals and \(\frac{a}{b} (\frac{x}{y}) < 0\), which of the following must be true?
A. \(ab < 0\)
B. \(\frac{a}{b} (\frac{x}{y}) < -1\)
C. \(\frac{a}{b} < 1\)
D. \(\frac{a}{b} = \frac{-y}{x}\)
E. \(\frac{y}{x} > \frac{a}{b}\)
Show
Hide
Answer
